intro: Festuca triplicifolia, commonly known as the three-leaf fescue, is a perennial grass species native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its fine, dark green foliage and compact growth habit, making it suitable for ornamental and lawn uses. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and forms dense mats through rhizomes. Its leaves are narrow and have a slightly hairy texture, while the inflorescence consists of spikelets arranged in a panicle. Festuca triplicifolia is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, preferring full sun to partial shade.
